metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1417 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
do_tgs_req.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5 (akakrb5) 1.11 before 1.11.4, when a single-component realm name is used,allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (daemoncrash) via a TGS-REQ request that triggers an attempted cross-realmreferral for a host-based service principal.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1417` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
krb5-gss-samples - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
krb5-kdc - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
krb5-locales - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
krb5-multidev - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
krb5-otp - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
krb5-pkinit - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
krb5-user - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libgssrpc4 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libk5crypto3 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libkadm5clnt-mit9 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libkadm5srv-mit8 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libkadm5srv-mit9 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libkdb5-7 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libkrad0 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libkrb5-3 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
libkrb5support0 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krb5 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu4').
